# Step 7 - SPA

Right now, webpack includes `main.js` in the bundle, but it does not care of our components. As a result, `game.component.js`, `welcome.component.js`, `card.component.js` and `score.component.js` are all ignored.

Now, we need to wire-them up through a bunch of `import` so they are part of the bundle.

For now, `html` files are responsible of calling their respective scripts and styles.
![multi_page]

The challenge of this step is to transform our current components so that our application becomes a **Single Page Application** (_SPA_).

> ![info] An _SPA_ means a single HTML document will be loaded for the entire life of the application.

In other words:

- Our application starts with a **Single HTML page** (`index.html`),
- `index.html` is loaded once, displays the shell (ie: the common navigation controls).
- `index.html` loads some javascript.
- The application has a **router** that listens to URL changes
- `WelcomeComponent`, `GameComponent` and `ScoreComponent` are registered to match respectively `/welcome`, `/game` and `/score` urls
- When the url changes, the router patches `index.html` the view of the matching component

That is, we move from an _html-centric_ design to a _javascript-centric_ design.
![single_page]

There is a lot of code to transform, so to begin with, let's focus on `GameComponent`.

## Step 7.1 - Refactor `GameComponent`

**Your job**

- Without router, no SPA! Copy the file [`resources/router/router.js`](../resources/router/router.js) into your `utils` folder.
  This file declares the router that will display components according to the current URL.

  > ![info] As you can see with router's `_renderComponent` method, the router will call any `Component.init()` method if it exists.

- `game.component.html` has the following lines:

  ```html
  <!-- front-end/src/app/components/game/game.component.html -->

  <template id="card-template">
    <main class="card-cmp">
      <div class="card-wrapper">
        <img class="card front-face" alt="card" />
        <img class="card back-face" alt="card" src="./card/assets/back.png" />
      </div>
    </main>
  </template>
  ```

  This defines a view for `CardCompnent`. Move the content of `<template>` tag into a new `card.component.html` file:

  ```html
  <!-- front-end/src/app/components/game/card/card.component.html -->
  <main class="card-cmp">
    <div class="card-wrapper">
      <img class="card front-face" alt="card" />
      <img class="card back-face" alt="card" src="./assets/back.png" />
    </div>
  </main>
  ```

  remove the empty `<template>` tag from `game.component.html`

  > ![warning] Do not forget to change `<img src="...">` from `"./card/assets/back.png"` to "`./assets/back.png`"

- Create the shell in `index.html`.

  > ![tip] We call **Shell** all the navigation and controls that remains unchanged from one page to another. In our application, this means the **top nav** (`<nav class="navbar ...">`, and the **footer** (`<footer>`))

  At the moment, all of our `welcome.component.html`, `game.component.html` & `score.componet.html` reimplement their own copy of the shell.

  Move all the common elements (`<body>`, `<head>`, `<nav>`, `<footer>`, ...) from `game.component.html` to in `index.html`, **and drop all the `<script>` and `<link>` tags**.
  ![shell-html]

- in `index.html`, add a `<div>` with the `id="content-outlet"` just below `<div class="container-fluid ..."`:

  ```html
  <!-- front-end/src/index.html -->

  <!-- ... -->
  <nav class="navbar bg-primary mb-3 shadow">
    <!-- ... -->
  </nav>

  <div class="container-fluid flex-grow-1 overflow-auto">
    <div id="content-outlet"></div>
    <!-- ^^^^^^^^  HERE ^^^^^^^^^^^ -->

    <footer class="navbar position-absolute fixed-bottom bg-dark">
      <span>&copy The MEME ory corporation | 2021</span>
    </footer>
  </div>
  <!-- ... -->
  ```

  This is where the router will put the view for the current component.

Make sur the url of your logo is `<img class="d-inline-block align-top" src="./assets/logo_take_my_money.png" alt="logo">` within the `index.html` file.

- Rewrite `game.component.js` and `card.component.js` to be ES6 modules.
  Locate the followitn statements at the bottom of the file:

  ```js
  window.GameComponent = GameComponent;
  ```

  ```js
  window.CardComponent = CardComponent;
  ```

  We used to need this to "export" the components. Now with ES6 modules, remove this statement, and just `export` the class:

  ```javascript
  // game.component.js

  export class GameComponent {}
  ```

  > ![info] Closures are not necessary anymore when we have ES6 modules. It's time to drop them all.

- We should now give our components a way to display their respective HTML and CSS:

  - copy file [`resources/component/component.js`](../resources/component/component.js) into your `utils/` folder.
    This defines a `class Component {}` with a `getTemplate()`, that should return the template of the current component.
  - Let `CardComponent` and `GameComponent` extend the `Component` class defined above.

  ```js
  // front-end/src/app/components/game/game.component.js
  import { Component } from "../../utils/component";

  export class GameComponent extends Component {
    // ...
  }
  ```

  ```js
  // front-end/src/app/components/game/card/card.component.js
  import { Component } from "../../../utils/component";

  export class CardComponent extends Component {
    // ...
  }
  ```

  > ![warning] Do not forget to `import {Component} from '../../utils/component'`

  - `GameComponent` and `CardComponent` constructors should respectively call `super("game")` and `super("card")` constructor

    ```js
    // front-end/src/app/components/game/game.component.js
    import { Component } from "../../utils/component";

    export class GameComponent implements Component {
      constructor() {
        super("game");
        // ...
      }
    }
    ```

    ```js
    // front-end/src/app/components/game/card/card.component.js
    import { Component } from "../../../utils/component";

    export class CardComponent implements Component {
      constructor(id) {
        super("card");
        // ...
      }
    }
    ```

  The `Component` class will use the provided name to create custom `<game>` and `<card>` html tags.

- Implement `getTemplate()` method in `game.component.js`:

  ```js
  // front-end/src/app/components/game/game.component.js
  import { CardComponent } from "./card/card.component";
  import template from "./game.component.html";

  export class GameComponent implements Component {
    getTemplate() {
      return template;
    }
  }
  ```

  Import both `"./card/card.component.js"` and `./game.component.html`.

  > ![tip] See [`game.component.js`](resources/component/game.component.js) and [`card.component.js`](resources/component/card.component.js) for reference.

- Implement `getTemplate()` method in `card.component.js`, and remove the `getElement()` method as it is now implemented by parent `Component` class.

  ```js
  // front-end/src/app/components/game/card/card.component.js
  import "./card.component.css";
  import template from "./card.component.html";

  export class CardComponent {
    getTemplate() {
      return template;
    }

    /* getElement() {
      // ...
    } */
  }
  ```

  Import both `"./card.component.css"` and `./card.component.html`.

  > ![tip] Importing CSS and HTML in javascript is made possible because we configured webpack with some loaders to supports these file types.

- While in `card.component.js`, you should also update the url toward images, and use absolutes URL as sugested bu comment `TODO Step 7`.

```js
export class CardComponent extends Component {
  constructor(id) {
    super("card");

    // ...
    // TODO Step 7: Update the path for images
    this._imageElt.querySelector(
      "img.front-face"
    ).src = `src/app/components/game/card/assets/card-${this._id}.png`;
    this._imageElt.querySelector("img.back-face").src =
      "src/app/components/game/card/assets/back.png";
  }
}
```

- Lastly, open the `main.js` file. Because it is the entrypoint of our `webpack.config.js`,
  it is of its responsibility to load all the components of our application. Replace its content with the following:

  ```javascript
  // front-end/src/main.js

  import "bootstrap/dist/css/bootstrap.css";
  import "./app/styles/style.css";

  import { Router } from "./app/utils/router";
  import { GameComponent } from "./app/components/game/game.component";
  // import { WelcomeComponent } from "./app/components/welcome/welcome.component";  // TODO Step 7 uncomment
  // import { ScoreComponent } from "./app/components/score/score.component";  // TODO Step 7 uncomment

  const outlet = document.querySelector("#content-outlet");

  const router = new Router(outlet)
    // .register("", WelcomeComponent) // TODO Step 7 uncomment
    .register("game", GameComponent);
  // .register("score", ScoreComponent); // TODO Step 7 uncomment
  ```

  The code above tells the router do the following:

  - pick up the `<div id="content-outlet">` from `index.html` as a reference element to put components inside.
  - Registers `GameComponent` to be loaded when the url is `localhost:8080#game`

  > ![info] We do not give `WelcomeComponent` a path, because we want it to be loaded at the root of our application.

This step was huge, but it is nearly over. Now, you should navigate to [http://localhost:8080#game](http://localhost:8080#game). You should be able to play the game again. The other page do not work yet, you will have to fix this in the next step.

> ![info] Did you note the change un URL? We used to play the game at url `localhost:8080/src/app/components/game/game.html`, but now the url is simply `localhost:8080#game`. Because we now have an SPA, everything happens right in `index.hml`, and the hastag (`#`) in url is used to load match a component without changing the URI.

#### Files produced:

```
front-end/src/main.js
front-end/src/index.html
front-end/src/app/utils.router.js
front-end/src/app/components/game/card/card.component.html
```

#### Checklist

- [ ] My application is now an SPA.

**![commit] commit step**

## Step 7.2 - Refactor `WelcomeComponent` and `ScoreComponent`

As we told earlier, going from one page to another now implies changing the `hashtag` instead of the `uri`.
We need to update the way redirects are handled from a component to anoter:

- Go to `welcome.component.js`, and change the method `_startGame`:
  ```javascript
  // front-end/src/app/components/welcome/welcome.component.js
  function _startGame(name, size) {
    window.location.hash = `game?name=${name}=name&size=${size}`;
  }
  ```
- Go to `game.component.js`, and change the method `gotoScore()` with the following:

  ```javascript
  // front-end/src/app/components/game/game.component.js
  gotoScore() {
    const timeElapsedInSeconds = Math.floor(
      (Date.now() - this._startTime) / 1000
    );

    setTimeout(() => window.location.hash = `score?name=${this._name}&size=${this._size}'&time=${timeElapsedInSeconds}`, 750);
  }
  ```

At the end of this step, you should be able to play the game as usual, and the 3 components should render without any errors.

**Your job**:

- The same way we changed `CardComponent` and `GameComponent` in the the previous step, transform `WelcomeComponent` and `ScoreComponent` as well
- Search for all `TODO Step 7` comments to track all changes that should be made

> ![question] Play the whole game with `size=2`. By browsing the 3 views of the application, how many files did your browser download in total? How many time did it took to load them all?

#### Checklist

- [ ] My application is now an SPA.
- [ ] I left no unresolved `// TODO Step 7` in my code
- [ ] My application runs as usual
- [ ] All my HTML, JS and CSS code is now **bundled** within a single js file

**![commit] commit step**
